summary:
Adds a character creation option with the 21 classic classes of the Elder Scrolls series available for play or to create a custom class.

Adds the option of selecting a birthsign at character creation.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/TitleCard.jpg[/img][/center]

[color=orange]I hope you enjoy this mod! If you do, please endorse it! Thank you![/color]

[color=tan][b]== Latest Version ==[/b][/color]
[b]Ver 2.4[/b]
- Witchhunter now has Conjuration as a Major Skill instead of Restoration. This brings it in line with skill distribution in both Morrowind and Oblivion.
- Acrobatics Secondary Skill now has 15% increased Stamina Regeneration in addition to falling damage reduction.
- Athletics Secondary Skill now has 15% increased Stamina Regeneration, and movement speed bonus has been reduced to 15% (from 25%).
- Cleaned up .esp and fixed typos and tooltip errors.

[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/OverviewTitle.jpg[/img][/center]All Elder Scrolls games prior to Skyrim had character creation begin with selecting a class and choosing your character\'s birthsign. In Arena and Daggerfall there were 18 distinct and unique classes to choose from, and in Oblivion and Morrowind they increased that number to 21. Each with different major skills and advantages, and allowed the player to better conceptualize their character as well as provide a different starting experience for each new game played. 

Characters were also said to be born under a certain sign, and choosing a birthsign at character creation allowed you to customize your starting character even further.

In Skyrim, this option was removed and all characters now start the same. The interesting and unique classes that Bethesda had created and fleshed out across four different games have been removed, and now you must spend your first hours in the game wandering to align with a standing stone to get the starsign you want. This mod changes that.  


[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/CompatibilityTitle.jpg[/img][/center]This mod is safe to use with current characters. If you load a savegame with a level 1 char it *will* bring up character selection, and run normally. For any character level 2 or higher, the current character menu will appear and give the option to add a class\'s Secondary Skill and Class Ability, as well as a Birthsign.

[color=tan][b]The mod should be fully compatible with:[/b][/color]
-Alternate Start mods, such as Live Another Life 
-Custom Race and racial ability adjustment mods, such as RaRe and Third Era Attributes

[color=tan][b]The mod is mostly compatible with:[/b][/color]
- SkyRe (Skyrim Redone). This mod is compatible with SkyRe (I use it myself) which merges Pickpocket and Lockpicking into \"Fingersmithing\"). So, any Class which starts with Lockpicking as a Major Skill will instead have their Vampirism skill start at 25, and Fingersmithing will be determined by whether the class has Pickpocket as a Major Skill or not.

Luckily, the latest version of SkyRe allows you to choose whether or not to include Vampirism perk tree, so you can disable it if you don’t want to use it. If you *do* want to use SkyRe Vampirism, and your character has Lockpicking as a Major Skill, here is a simple workaround;
Use these Console Command after starting the game:
player.setAV lockpicking 15
player.setAV pickpocket 25

This will set your character\'s “Vampirism” to 15, and \"Fingersmithing\" to 25, without leveling up your character all. Class Abilities and unaffected.


[color=tan][b]The mod will likely not be compatible with:[/b][/color]
- Mods that alter the base skill points of the player. However, if Classic Classes is loaded AFTER the other mod in the mod order, CC will still work, but I can’t guarantee the other mod will continue to work correctly.

If you find a conflict, please let me know and I will work to resolve it!


[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/ClassicClassesTitle.jpg[/img][/center]Class Selection will begin after you equip a weapon or spell for the first time. 

Each of the 21 Classic Classes are based on the classes available in Oblivion and Morrowind and are broken down into three specialties: Combat, Stealth and Magic. 

[color=tan][b]Major Skills[/b][/color]
Classic Classes characters start with all skills at 5 pts (novice level). Each class has several Major Skills which start at 25 pts (apprentice level) before racial bonuses are applied. This represents your character’s profession or skills learned prior to the start of the game.

[color=tan][b]Secondary Skills[/b][/color]
Secondary skills are abilities that represent basic skills learned in previous training that cannot improve any further, nor do they contribute to your character’s overall experience level. There are five Secondary Skills:
[b]Hand to Hand |[/b] +10 Unarmed Combat Damage
[b]Athletics |[/b] Move 15% faster, Stamina regenerates 15% faster
[b]Acrobatics |[/b] Take 75% less falling damage, Stamina regenerates 15% faster
[b]Unarmored |[/b] Armor rating is 50 when not wearing armor
[b]Mysticism |[/b] Magicka regenerates 25% faster

[color=tan][b]Class Abilities[/b][/color]
Each Classic Class starts with a Class Ability that represents the training they received prior to arriving in Skyrim and gives them an edge over those who have had to teach themselves. In some cases, this is a bonus Novice-level perk. In others, this bonus is separate, but stacks with other similar bonuses from perks, etc. 

[color=tan][b]Starting Spells[/b][/color]
Characters that start with a Major Skill in one of the magical schools will start with one novice and one apprentice spell for that school.

[color=tan][b]Default-style Characters[/b][/color]
If you wish to play Skyrim using the default character progression, no need to uninstall! Simply select \"Adventurer\" from the main menu and your character will have 15 pts in every skill (before racial bonuses are applied) as well as the default spell loadout. This allows you to player a default character but still choose a birthsign.
 
Full class descriptions can be found under the aptly named “Class Descriptions” section of this document, as well as the in-game menus.

[color=tan][b]Custom Class Creation[/b][/color]
To choose a custom class, select “Custom Class” from the main menu. You will be provided the opportunity to choose 7 Major Skills, as well as a +20 bonus to either Health, Stamina or Magicka.

[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/ClassListingTitle.jpg[/img][/center][b]Combat specialists[/b] focus on melee or ranged weaponry and use armor to protect themselves from harm.  
The combat classes are: Archer, Barbarian, Crusader, Knight, Rogue, Scout, and Warrior.

[b]Stealth specialists[/b] focus on avoiding detection and sneak attacks to give them the edge in combat. 
The stealth classes are: Acrobat, Agent, Assassin, Bard, Monk, Pilgrim and Thief.

[b]Magic specialists[/b] focus on the arcane arts and spellcasting, sometimes combined with martial skills, to achieve their goals. 
The magic classes are: Battlemage, Healer, Mage, Nightblade, Sorcerer, Spellsword and Witchhunter. 


[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/BirthsignsTitle.jpg[/img][/center]After class selection, players are given the option of choosing which of the nineteen constellations their character was born under. As a Dragonborn, you can choose to come under the effect of the starsigns as they shone during the Third Era, or as they shine in the Fourth Era, or choose The Traveler to skip birthsign selection at character creation and continue with default play.

[color=tan][b]Default Play[/b][/color]
If you wish to start with no birthsign, select the wandering star, The Traveler, and your character will start play with no starsign attuned - just as in default play. 

[color=tan][b]Fourth Era Birthsigns[/b][/color]
The Fourth Era birthsigns share the same powers as Skyrim’s standing stones but are chosen at character creation. These powers can be exchanged at any time for another standing stone’s power at any of the stones in the game. A full description of each can be found on the Unofficial Elder Scrolls Pages
http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Standing_Stones

[color=tan][b]Third Era Birthsigns[/b][/color]
The Third Era Birthsigns are unique and based upon the birthsign abilities in Oblivion and Morrowind. These are chosen at character creation and remain with your character throughout play. They cannot be changed once chosen. However, you can still come under the effects of a standing stone power by attuning yourself to the stone. Just like in Oblivion, birthsign and standing stone abilities DO stack! The Third Era Birthsign abilities are as follows:
[b]The Warrior |[/b] Deal 20% increased damage with weapons
[b]The Lady |[/b] Fortify Health 20 pts and Magicka regenerates 25% faster
[b]The Lord |[/b] Restore 60 Health over 15 seconds for 100 Magicka, take 25% more damage from fire
[b]The Steed |[/b] Move 25% faster
[b]The Thief |[/b] 40 additional Armor Rating
[b]The Lover |[/b] Once per day, you can paralyze a foe for 10 seconds
[b]The Shadow [/b]| Once per day, turn invisible for 60 seconds
[b]The Tower |[/b] 10% reflect damage
[b]The Mage |[/b] 30 bonus Magicka
[b]The Apprentice |[/b] 50 bonus Magicka, 50% weakness to magic
[b]The Atronach |[/b] 100 bonus Magicka, Magicka does not regenerate, 50% chance to absorb spells
[b]The Ritual |[/b] Once per day, heal yourself for 200 Health. Once per day, cast Mass Turn Undead
[b]The Serpent |[/b] Once per day, potent poison on touch. Cast Cure Poison on Self.


[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/InstallTitle.jpg[/img][/center]To [b][color=lightblue]Install[/b][/color], simply copy to to your ~/skyrim/data folder and activate the ClassicClasses.esp

To [b][color=red]Uninstall[/color][/b], remove the following files:
~/skyrim/data/ClassicClasses.esp
~/skyrim/data/ClassicClasses.BSA



[center][img]http://i1086.photobucket.com/albums/j453/Mill3rjunk/Skyrim%20Mod%20Images/KnownIssuesTitle.jpg[/img][/center]- The speed boost granted by the Third Era Steed birthsign saves to the character. If you uninstall the mod and want to remove the speed boost from that character, type this into the console: player.setav speedmult 100
- If the menu does not appear when you first equip a weapon, it is likely your using an older version of the game. I am not sure why this is required, probably has to do with script processing, but please make sure your game is fully up-to-date if you are having this issue.
- Please report any bugs and I will work to squash them!
